result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis D. Walker

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquis D. Walker appeared by video.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Marquis D. Walker. Court takes Judicial Notice of 10CM2489. Officer Noe Mar-Garcia sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:53 AM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquis D. Walker in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Marquis D. Walker. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity:Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:05 PM Defendant Marquis D. Walker in court by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David S Olson  and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:16 PM Defendant Marquis D. Walker in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Jason D Sanders and legal intern Olivia Long appearing by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified,  charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Signature bond set of $1000.00   with conditions, Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No driving with out valid drivers license or valid insurance. Adjourned initial appearance June 15, 2022 at 1:00 pm.
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No driving with out valid drivers license or valid insurance.
